ZIOS-10730: Fix email login prefill after logging in with phone (#2806)

* Prefill the email for needsPasswordToRegisterClient error

When the user signs in with a phone number, but the account has an associated email, we didn’t prefill the email from the login credentials.

* Actually sign out the user when they cancel giving their password

When a user with email logs in and is asked for a password, they can cancel giving the password. If they do so, we delete the account from the account manager, instead of just selecting another account.

* Do not actually delete the account as this removes history

Add thumbnail creation method taking max shorter side length instead of max length (#2393)

* Add image thumbnail creation function taking max shorter side length instead of max length

When creating a thumbnail using CoreImage the max length is specified, however for non-square and especially panoramic images this means the longer side will have a maximum length of the specified value. In the collections view we display th eimages in a square format in image views using the aspect fill content mode, we thus want the shorter side of the image to be the one with the specified max length when creating a thumbnail. This PR adds a new method which takes a the shorter side length as parameter and calculates the max size based on the images aspect ratio.

As an example before when creating a max size 100pt thumbnail for a panomara with 4:1 aspect ratio the resulting height would be 25pt, now it will be 100pt.

* [skip ci] Return early for invalid size values

* Add snapshot tests and fix nullability annotations

Add workaround to fix empty list when opening push (#1683)

When leaving the application with the settings screen being visible last and opening a push notification to get into the app again, we try to dismiss all presented view controllers before showing the selected conversation. The settings screen is presented using a custom view controller transition `SwizzleTransition` which is presented over the current context and applies some transforms and alpha modifications to the conversation list.

For some reason though, the `transitioningDelegate` is not being queried to provide an `UIViewControllerAnimatedTransitioning` object when the view controller is being dismissed without animation. I would have assumed the delegate being queried and the transition contexts property `isAnimated` evaluating to false, so that the pre-presentation state can be restored. I haven't figured out why this is not the case here and will continue investigating.

This PR adds a fix restoring the correct alpha and transform of the `conversationListViewController's` view when dismissing modals non-animated.

clear error message when verification code edited (#1477)

Remove ‘on’ from Edited/Deleted timestamps (#1474)

Since timestamps are dynamic, they may appear as either date or time values.

‘On’ works for date values, but not for time values, where ‘at’ would be correct.

Rather than creating 2 separate strings to handle these grammar differences, this commit removes the preposition entirely, so the same text can be used for both cases.

configure a view controller on didFinishLaunching. We can fix this by
always configuring the launch controller view controller before any
other view controller.

Remove .bool case from SettingsPropertyValue (#667)

* Add test to track settings bug progress

* Remove .bool case from SettingsProperty

* When retrieving a value from the UserDefaults we were losing the type information, specifically if the value we set represents a `Bool` or for example an `Int`, this lead to bugs (e.g. [#8005](https://wearezeta.atlassian.net/browse/ZIOS-8005)).
* We now store all numbers and booleans as `NSNumbers`, the `.bool` case has been removed from the `SettingsPropertyValue`.
* Convenience initializers have been added to the `SettingsPropertyValue` to create a new value using an `Int`, `Bool` or `UInt`, this avoids duplicated `NSNumber` wrapping on the caller side.
* A test to catch the bug storing an integer value higher than 1 has been added, before this change retrieving the value would result in a `true` / `1` being returned.
* Add `@discardableResult` to `open()` method on `URL` to remove warning.

Remove username interface feature flag (#459)

* Remove username interface feature flag

* As the username related endpoints are not promoted to the production BE yet we introduced a feature flag to disable the UI as well as disable the calls to sync-engine to find an available username suggestion (as this would have lead to a request loop because a 404 could mean the username is available / NOT FOUND or that the endpoint is not deployed).
* With a new endpoint specifically for bulk checking username availability, which returns a 200 and the available usernames from the sent suggestions we can now remove this feature flag and rely on the fact that we will get a 404 if the BE has not deployed the endpoint and an empty array otherwise.
* It can be discussed to move the call to get a suggested username in `viewWillAppear` to ensure the client does not have to be restarted in case the endpoint was not yet available the last time it has been started.

* Bump wire-ios-sync-engine

Fix table view cell height for empty cell to avoid negative value crashes

Fix header view moving up on successive connection requests (#463)

* The height of the `ConnectionRequestCell`, which should neither be used nor inserted anymore was set to 0, which unfortunately will make the table view set it to the default height of 40. We now set it to 0.5 to ensure the header view does not get pushed up (as we use a rotated tableview we actually set the footer view when setting a header view, but as the default position will be scrolled to the bottom the header view will be pushed out of the visible viewport).
* The underlying issue that we still insert connection request system messages into the conversation should be fixed in `wire-ios-sync-engine`.

Feature/usernames conversation menu (#450)

* Split connection view in incoming and outgoing classes

This splits `UserConnectionView` in two separate classes, `UserConnectionView` and `IncomingConnectionView`. While `UserConnectionView` does not contain any controls anymore (the cancel request and archive button have been moved into a separate class called `OutgoingConnectionBottomBar`) and is shown at the top of 1-on-1 conversations, the `IncomingConnectionView` is used to show incoming requests and has a ignore and accept button. The controls for outgoing connection requests have been moved into a separate control to make the header more reusable and fix layout issues for outgoing requests.

Only observe user profile updates when there is no handle yet (#446)

* Only observe user profile updates when there is no handle yet

* Both the `ConversationListViewController` as well as the `ChangeHandleViewController` are observing updates to the user profile, which lead to a case in which the user was changing the handle in settings, and the callback in the conversation list (which never gets deallocated) was presenting the settings screen again on a failure.
* The common connection count should only be shown when the users are not connected.
* Make the table view in the `ChangeHandleViewController` non-scrollable and disable autocorrection for the textfield.
* Recheck suggested handle availability when initialising a `ChangeHandleViewController` with a suggested handle to avoid an initially enabled save button.

* Update footer font in change handle view controller

* If the user leaves a conversation he can delete previously sent messages only using "delete for me".

Fix/giphy fixes (#286)

* Put back via giphy message

Use safer random functions (#285)

On 32-bit platforms, `Int` is actually `Int32` which ranges from `-2^31` to `2^31-1`. However `arc4random` returns `UInt32` up to `2^32-1`. I think the crash we were seeing was on 32-bit machine generating a random that was too big to fit in `Int32`.

Additionally, according to Apple's documentation:
> arc4random_uniform() is recommended over constructions like ``arc4random() % upper_bound'' as it avoids
> "modulo bias" when the upper bound is not a power of two.
(https://developer.apple.com/legacy/library/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/man3/arc4random.3.html)
so I replaced all `arc4random() % ...`

Fix crash on message deletion (#158)

When a message is deleted, the cell in the table view is disposed. However, the cell keeps a reference to the message. When a new message is inserted, the cell is prepared for reuse, and it still has a reference to the old message; accessing the old message causes a crash.
This was fixed by clearing any reference to the old message before preparing the cell for reuse.

* Fix reactions not updating when a user first likes a message

The reactionsChangeInfo is `nil` in case the user has not reacted to a message before, this is caused by the way the observation internally works. The Message observer observers its reactions relation and adds a `ReactionObserver` to added reactions, this means that this `ReactionObserver` can not fire in case this reactions has not been added before. Because of this issue the UI should always check the `reactionsChanged` flag instead of the `reactionsChangeInfo` directly. We might address this issue on the data-model side by either creating a `ReactionChangeInfo` manually or making the `reactionsChangeInfo` private.

Unify UIMenuController item order to make `delete` always appear last (#104)

* Unify UIMenuController item order to make `delete` always appear last

From the Apple documentation:  "Custom items appear in the menu after any system menu items." This means that the `-delete:` selector can not be used, but a custom menu item has to be added if we want to guarantee that the delete item is displayed last (after other custom items like for example `save`). Because the `-delete:` can not be used we now use `-deleteMessage:` as custom selector and spend a custom menu item to the menu controller.

Update the script to download the AVS binary from multiple sources (#42)

* Update the script to download the AVS binary from multiple sources

If the right environment variables are set, the AVS binary can be downloaded from a custom location (GitHub repository that has a release with an attachment).

The variables to set are:
- `AVS_REPO`: the custom "organization/repo" where to find AVS binaries
- `GITHUB_USER `: the GitHub user that has access to that repository (if auth is needed)
- `GITHUB_TOKEN `: the GitHub password or personal access token (if auth is needed)

More variables can be set to override the version, if needed:
- `AVS_VERSION` to download a specific version

* Fix authentication for travis in AVS download script

This is a tentative fix, will see if Travis will pass with this change
